meanings.definition: Relating to the study of ancient writing systems.
meanings.sent1: The paleographically significant manuscript provided valuable insights into ancient languages.
meanings.sent2: The researcher examined the paleographically unique symbols on the ancient tablet.
meanings.sent3: The paleographically complex hieroglyphics made the archaeologist's head spin.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting was so paleographically distinct, it was like deciphering a secret code.
meanings.sent5: The paleographically intricate calligraphy was a work of art in itself.

meanings.definition: In a manner related to the analysis of historical scripts.
meanings.sent1: She studied the document paleographically, focusing on the script's details.
meanings.sent2: The historian analyzed the text paleographically to determine its age.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly tried to read the menu paleographically, pretending it was an ancient scroll.
meanings.sent4: The detective examined the ransom note paleographically, searching for hidden clues.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the concept paleographically, using examples from old manuscripts.
